byline.contributor: Patrick McGee reported from Arlington, and Manny Fernandez from Houston. Ashley Southall contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By PATRICK McGEE and MANNY FERNANDEZ

abstract: Brad Miller, white police officer who shot and killed unarmed black teenager Christian Taylor in Arlington, Tex, is fired for showing 'inappropriate judgement' in situation; firing and censure of Miller represents shift in official narrative that previously sought to blame Taylor in his own death.
lead_paragraph: Officer Brad Miller was dismissed after what was described as a series of troubling decisions that led to the death of Mr. Taylor, an unarmed black 19-year-old.

headline.main: Arlington, Tex., Officer Is Fired in Fatal Shooting of Christian Taylor
headline.print_headline: Officer Is Fired in Texas Killing of Black Man
